items.content:
Dear 2HGL students,

Today you are going to work on a
new topic that you have never
heard before:
The Past Simple.

After following the steps:
the students will be able to
achieve the following goals.

1. At the end of this digital course,
you will be able to tell a story in
the Past Simple.
2. At the end of this digital course,
you will know how to use the
Past Simple.

3. At the end of this digital course,
you practised with your listening skills
and recognise Past Simple verbs in a song.

Overall, I wish you all goodluck
and have fun with practising your
abilities in this digital course!

Watch the video about the Past Simple.
After you are finished watching the video --> Continue with the questions that are under this video

questions.label: When do we use the Past Simple?

prompt.body: When do we use the Past Simple?

content.body: To talk about finished actions in the past.
When we want to talk about something happening right now.

prompt.body: How do we change a regular verb to the past?

content.body: We add -ED and remove TO before the verb.
Correct!
We remove TO before the verb and remove the last letter of the verb.
We add -ed after the verb, not remove the last verb.
We add -D and remove TO before the verb.
Have a look at the video.

Jackson and I to school yesterday. (To walk)
After school, we . eachother. (to hug)
After a long day the students to their favourite music. (to listen)

questions.label: Fill in the verbs into the Past Simple

content.body: We add -ed to the verb. With hug --> we need to use another g to get the pronounciation correctly. So, it changes to hugged.

Have a look back at the video! How do we form a Past Simple with regular verbs. Hug needs a little bit of help --> it has to get something extra to get the pronounciation right, you can google this up! :)

questions.label: What is the irregular form of to be?

prompt.body: What is the irregular verb of to be in the Past?

content.body: Was/were
Am/were
Is/were

items.content: Here we have a few examples of the most common irregular verbs in English!

Hele werkwoord

Verleden tijd

Voltooid deelwoord

Vertaling

To be

Was/were

Been

Zijn/ worden

To Have

Had

Had

Hebben

To see

Saw

Seen

Zien

To go

Went

Gone

Gaan

To buy

Bought

Bought

Kopen

To catch

Caught

Caught

Vangen

To burn

Burnt

Burnt

branden

To do

Did

Done

Doen

To eat

Ate

Eaten

Eten

heading.content: Practise makes perfect with the irregular verbs

items.content: Do you get 6 points or more? Continue with the next step: The past sang a story. Did you have 5 points or less? Do the extra practise activity!

<iframe width="640px" height="480px" src="https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=zrpvyrp8U02GgaBihPf_RsiCkV2NK1dBprF1-kCDMN9UQTBTRFNYN09YT0pVVkgyMUZLRTM1TkMyWS4u&embed=true" frameborder="0" marginwidth="0" marginheight="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen" webkitallowfullscreen="" mozallowfullscreen="" msallowfullscreen=""/>
Look at the video, answer the questions that are asked during the video. After you have answered question, continue with the practise exercise!
Connect the following verbs with the right form in the Past Simple

prompt.body: Can you help me lining the correct verbs with the right usage of the Past Simple?

content.body: Jack ........ me with his silly joke.
Kitty ....... again because she had failed her exam again.
Jackson and Lesley ............. to Amsterdam last month.
I ........ on my best friend last week.
I ..... quite happy about the feedback.
Spied
Travelled
tricked
Cried
Was

items.content:
You are going to listen to the video: Tough love - The villains Lair, you have to listen to the video 2x!
You are going to fill in the missing words in the story.
Hopefully, you can help me fill in those lines!

header.title: Fill in the missing Past Simples

content.body:
Ever since I was a girl my own mother
I must find the way to power through a noble brow
I once for love, then my senses came
I must marry for the stature of my husband's name
Onto marriage number two
I knew what I to do
And my poor husband fell ill in a year or two
Solved problem number one, now to problem number two
His doe-eyed little girl with gentle point of view

Would I ship her off to school?
No! I told her if she that she'd have
To earn her keep and so she the maid
She was lazy
She crazy
She was talking to the mice
She was hopelessly naive, so she to pay the price
I her to the attic out of sight and out of mind
I could have thrown her out, but I'm benevolent and kind
Mother, your heart's too big for you
I knew what I had to do
After all, difficult children will take advantage of your good nature

So you lock them up from away the key
There's one on every family tree
Ungrateful
Hateful
Vile too, the things she put you through

.............

I ask you, is it a crime to strive for perfection in all things?
Oh no, they're so cute when they're little but
Then they grow up and just ruin everything

I never children, life was better on my own
All the screaming, nagging chilled me to the bone
But then one day I came across a flower growing free
It's magic kept me young, so I kept it all for me
But someone dug it up, now a baby held the power
So I "borrowed" her, her up and her in a tower
Years by, Oh, the sacrifice
And against my better judgment, I fed her once or twice
Teenagers now I know I wild eat their young
But that's messy
Manipulation's easily more fun
A little guilt, a lot of force of course you have to lie
Remind them that without you, they'd shrivel up and die

They only have themselves to blame
If you'd been there, you'd do the same
So work them hard 'til they fall in line
There's one way and it's only mine
The children are lazy
too
But we know what to do
Govern them with a heart of stone
Lock them up, so they're all alone
Maybe you'd call it cruel but
Others would call it love, tough love

.......

prompt.body: Do you believe that the three women are talking positive about the heroes?

content.body: Yes, they are singing brightly what their opinion is all about. It seems positive and unharmful.
No, It's all evil and the three women are up to no good. They only did what was best for themselves.

items.content:
In this section, we are going to write down a once upon a time story.
You will write your story on the padlet!
In the padlet, you will see that there is an example story of
how the story could be written!
Your story should have the following things:
1. Two characters
2. 4 irregular verbs
3. 3 regular verbs
4. A setting

The story should be around the 75-100 words

<iframe width="640px" height="480px" src="https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=zrpvyrp8U02GgaBihPf_RsiCkV2NK1dBprF1-kCDMN9UREVKSU9UMFc1NjlXTlpUQVNJSkRSU0tLRi4u&embed=true" frameborder="0" marginwidth="0" marginheight="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen" webkitallowfullscreen="" mozallowfullscreen="" msallowfullscreen=""/>

First video: My own animated clip by the help of Animaker. https://youtu.be/08iPsqYoiu8

Second video: Used from EdPuzzle --> https://edpuzzle.com/media/5f0869ea63a35a3f12d927a1

Third video: Pattycake Productions - Tough Love The villains lair, retrieved from youtube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kBF5l9rWQFs

Last but not least, all the pictures are from a free licensed site: https://pixabay.com/nl/  All the activities are created by myself, therefore, I do not have to put it on my source list.
